questions.question: The temperature of the gases within the cylinder of a four-stroke engine during the power stroke will:

options.content: be constant
decrease
increase
follow Charlesˊs Law

questions.question: The number of revolutions of the crankshaft required to complete a full cycle in a four-stroke engine is:
The inlet valve opens before TDC in the exhaust stroke to:

options.content: increase the pressure in the cylinder on completion of the induction stroke.
reduce engine vibration
allow the incoming mixture to mix with a certain proportion of the exhaust gases
induce a greater amount of mixture into the cylinder

questions.question: The correct working cycle of a four-stroke engine is:

options.content: exhaust, power, induction, compression
compression, power, exhaust, induction
induction, power, compression, exhaust
power, exhaust, compression, induction

questions.question: Valve overlap is incorporated in the valve timing of a piston engine to:

options.content: improve volumetric efficiency
reduce wear on the big end bearings
increase the engines compression ratio
prevent a weak cut when the engine is accelerated rapidly

questions.question: With an increase in the rotational speed of a four-stroke engine, the valve overlap:

options.content: increases
decreases
remains constant
increases up to ground idle and thereafter decreases

questions.question: In a normally aspirated engine, exhaust back pressure:

options.content: decreases as an aircraft climbs and thereby reduces the rate of decline of the engine power output
increases as an aircraft climbs and thereby reduces the engine power output
is affected by the power lever position
decreases as an aircraft descends and thereby improves the engine power output

questions.question: When the spark ignites the mixture:

options.content: the explosion pushes the piston down
the mixture changes from rich to weak forward of the flame front
complete combustion occurs within 8 to 10 microseconds
temperature and pressure increase within the cylinder

questions.question: If the volume of a quantity of gas is halved during compression:

options.content: its pressure is approximately doubled
its temperature remains constant
its mass is approximately doubled
its pressure is approximately halved

questions.question: The term Indicated Mean Effective Pressure refers to:

options.content: the maximum working pressure in the engine cylinder
the average pressure within the cylinder during the four cycles
the pressure achieved during compression
the minimum working pressure applied to the piston during the cycle

questions.question: The degrees of rotation to complete a full cycle on a nine cylinder engine will be:
The firing interval of a six cylinder horizontally opposed engine will be:
Which of the following statements would be correct for a double banked radial engine?

options.content: There will always be an odd number of cylinders
Radial engines are generally liquid-cooled
The linear distance from TDC to BDC will accommodate two throws
Radial engines cannot suffer from hydraulicing

questions.question: On a four cylinder engine with a total volume of 9600 cc, bore area of 100 cm<sup>2</sup> and a crank throw of 10 cm, what would the Compression Ratio be?
With an increase in outside air temperature, specific fuel consumption will:

options.content: increase
decrease
stay the same
stay the same for all temperatures up to and including 15°C and thereafter

questions.question: Combustion, in a four-stroke engine, theoretically occurs at:

options.content: a constant pressure
a constant temperature
a constant volume
a constant velocity

questions.question: In a convergent duct:

options.content: the pressure and velocity increase, the temperature decreases
the pressure and temperature decrease, the velocity increases
the temperature and velocity increase, the pressure decreases
the pressure and velocity remain constant, the temperature decreases

questions.question: During the compression stroke:

options.content: the temperature of the gases remains constant
the volume of the gases increases
the mass of the mixture decreases
the mass of the mixture remains constant

questions.question: From Top Dead Centre (TDC) to Bottom Dead Centre (BDC) on the practical power stroke:

options.content: the temperature of the gases rises for a short time then decreases
the pressure of the gases remains constant
the temperature of the gases decreases from TDC to BDC
the density of the gas remains constant

questions.question: In a divergent duct:

options.content: the velocity and temperature increase, the pressure decreases
the temperature and pressure increase, the velocity decreases
the temperature and pressure decrease, the velocity increases
the velocity and temperature decrease, the pressure increases

questions.question: During the induction stroke:

options.content: the mixture becomes weaker
the volume of the gases becomes smaller
the temperature of the gases reduces
the pressure of the gases increases

questions.question: Ideally, maximum pressure is attained within the cylinder:

options.content: when combustion is complete
at the end of the compression stroke
during the period of valve overlap
when combustion temperature is at a minimum

questions.question: The power output of an internal combustion engine:

options.content: is proportional to the volume of mixture induced into the cylinder
increases with increased humidity
falls as the charge temperature falls
is proportional to the weight of the mixture induced into the cylinder

questions.question: During the period of valve overlap:

options.content: the action of the exhaust gases flowing past the exhaust valve increases the pressure within the cylinder
the temperature of the exhaust gases increases the mass of incoming mixture
the action of the exhaust gases flowing out past the exhaust valve tends to reduce the pressure in the cylinder
the crankshaft is moving past Bottom Dead Centre

questions.question: The power output of an internal combustion engine can be increased by:

options.content: increasing the area of the cylinder
increasing the length of the stroke
increasing the engine rpm
all of the above

questions.question: Valve Overlap is:

options.content: the number of degrees of camshaft rotation during which the inlet and exhaust valves are open at the same time
the number of degrees of crankshaft movement during which the inlet and exhaust valves are open at the same time
the distance the piston travels while the inlet valve remains open after BDC
the number of degrees of crankshaft rotation during which the inlet and exhaust valves are open at the same time around BDC

questions.question: The purpose of a valve spring is to:

options.content: close the valve
cause a snap opening of the valve
allow the valve timing to vary with changing rpm
maintain the valve clearance within tolerance

questions.question: Excessive blue smoke from the exhaust of an engine that has been warmed up to normal operating temperature may indicate that:

options.content: the mixture is too rich
the oil pressure relief valve has stuck in the open position
the piston rings are worn or stuck in their grooves
the oil pressure is too low

questions.question: The camshaft of a horizontally opposed four-stroke engine rotates at:

options.content: twice engine speed
engine speed
twice magneto speed
half engine speed

questions.question: A reduction gear is fitted:

options.content: between the camshaft and the propeller
between the pushrods and the valves
between the crankshaft and propeller
between the connecting rod and the crankshaft

questions.question: Prolonged use of low rpm could cause contamination of the:

options.content: oil filter
spark plug
carburretor
oil pump

questions.question: If the Starter Engaged Light remains on after engine start, you should:

options.content: shut the engine down immediately
ignore it if it remains on for longer than 30 seconds
shut the engine down if the light remains on for more than 30 seconds
shut the engine down if the light remains on for more than 60 seconds

questions.question: The crankshaft of typical in-line four cylinder aircraft engine:

options.content: rotates at half the speed of the camshaft
will have the crank throws spaced 90 degrees apart
allows a firing order of 1-3-4-2
will not flex or twist

questions.question: Two valve springs are fitted to each valve:

options.content: to minimize camshaft wear
to allow a greater cam rise
to prevent valve rotation
to reduce valve bounce

questions.question: Excessive valve clearance:

options.content: will prevent the valve closing completely
is eliminated when the engine reaches working temperature
will cause the valve to open early and close late
will cause the valve to open late and close early

questions.question: Valve lead occurs when:

options.content: the inlet valve opens before bottom dead centre
the exhaust valve opens before the inlet valve
the exhaust valve opens before top dead centre
the inlet valve opens before top dead centre and the exhaust valve opens before bottom dead centre

questions.question: Insufficient tappet clearance at the inlet valve would cause:

options.content: the valve to open early and close late
the valve to open late and close early
the mixture in that cylinder to be weak
misfiring

questions.question: The length of the stroke is:

options.content: equal to the length of the cylinder
determined by the size of the piston
equivalent to twice the crank throw
inversely proportional to the engine power output

questions.question: Tappet clearance is measured between the:

options.content: push rod and the valve tip
valve tip and the rocker pad
valve spring and the rocker pad
valve tip and the rocker cover

questions.question: The number of revolutions required to complete the induction and compression stroke in a six cylinder four-stroke engine is:
The purpose of a crankcase breather is to:

options.content: maintain the oil tank pressure at atmospheric
prevent distortion of the crankcase
allow the oil to breathe
prevent pressure building up inside the crankcase

questions.question: Tappet clearance is provided in a piston engine to:

options.content: adjust the valve timing
allow for expansion of the valve gear as the engine warms up
allow for manufacturing tolerances
prevent valve bounce

questions.question: Piston rings are manufactured from cast iron:

options.content: because it has a negative coefficient of expansion
to take advantage of its extreme malleability
because of its self-lubricating qualities
to take advantage of its brittleness

questions.question: The exhaust valves:

options.content: are opened directly by the action of push rods which are in turn operated by cams on the crankshaft
are less affected by the heat of combustion than the inlet valves
are opened by the valve springs and closed by the rocker gear
sometimes have their stems partly filled with sodium to assist cooling

questions.question: Hydraulic valve tappets are used on some engines to:

options.content: eliminate valve bounce
eliminate constant valve adjustment and checks
give a more positive closing action
give a more positive opening action

questions.question: The swept volume of a cylinder is:

options.content: the area of the bore * the stroke
the area of the cylinder cross section × the cylinder length
half of the clearance volume
the total volume + the piston volume

questions.question: The thermal efficiency of a piston engine can be increased by:

options.content: increasing the rpm
increasing the combustion chamber volume
advancing the ignition point into the direction of rotation
increasing the compression ratio

questions.question: A normally aspirated engine is one which:

options.content: has four cylinders
is not supercharged
is never air-cooled
is all of the above

questions.question: The Compression Ratio of an engine may be defined as the:

options.content: swept volume + clearance volume ÷ swept volume
swept volume + clearance volume ÷ clearance volume
total volume - clearance volume ÷ clearance volume
swept volume / (swept volume + clearance volume)

questions.question: An engine has a total volume of 2100 cm3 and a swept volume of 1800 cm<sup>3</sup>. Its compression ratio is:
Volumetric efficiency may be defined as:

options.content: the ratio of the volume of the mixture drawn into the cylinder during normal engine working, to the volume of the mixture which would be required to fill the cylinder under normal temperatures and pressures
the ratio of the volume of air and the volume of fuel drawn into the cylinder
the ratio of the volume of one of the cylinders to the volume of all of the cylinders in the engine
the efficiency with which the air and fuel mix together in the cylinder

questions.question: The ratio of the power produced by an engine to the power available in the fuel is known as the:

options.content: specific fuel consumption
indicated horsepower
volumetric efficiency
thermal efficiency

questions.question: Specific Fuel Consumption (SFC)

options.content: is the inability of the internal combustion engine to use any fuel other than that specified by the manufacturer
becomes greater as the efficiency of the engine improves
is the weight of fuel used by an engine per unit horsepower per unit time
increases in proportion to the thermal efficiency

questions.question: Brake Horsepower is:

options.content: theoretical power in the cylinder
useful power at the propeller
power lost in the engine
power required to slow the aircraft down

questions.question: A method of improving Volumetric Efficiency is:

options.content: valve overlap
the use of carburettor heat
weakening the mixture
to make the mixture richer
